data.event: The CFIA said that, "the cow could have likely lived another 6 months or so, but died of complications of mastitis".
"The animal's age is between eight and 10 years", said the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.

event.title: the introduction of new feed regulations in 1997

data.event: "The cow's exposure to BSE likely occurred before or during the introduction of new feed regulations in 1997 prohibiting use of cattle parts susceptible to the disease in certain animal feeds", A release said yesterday.
